title: Nancy's Chopped Salad

items.name: small red onion
items.preparation: peeled and sliced into paper-thin rings

items.name: provolone
items.notes: see Note about varieties, sliced 1/8-inch thick then cut into 1/4-inch ribbons

items.name: salami
items.preparation: peeled, sliced 1/8-inch thick then cut into 1/4-inch ribbons

items.name: iceberg lettuce
items.notes: see Note about size, halved, cored, and cut in 1/2-inch ribbons

items.name: radicchio
items.preparation: halved, cored and cut in 1/4-inch ribbons

items.name: dried oregano
items.notes: Nancy recommends 2; adjust according to preference

instructions: Roughly chop the garlic and then add the oregano, salt, and up to 1/2 teaspoon ground pepper. Chop the mixture together and use the side of a knife or a mortar and pestle to make a grainy herb paste. Transfer the paste to a large salad bowl, and add the lemon juice and vinegar. Mix with a fork allowing the salt to dissolve, then add the oil and whisk with a fork until well combined. The dressing should be thick with garlic and oregano. If you’re using a small head of iceberg, transfer 1/3 the dressing into a small bowl to be used only if needed. For a larger head of iceberg, you’ll want it all.

Gently fold the chickpeas, red onion, provolone, salami, pepperoncini (including seeds and juice) into the dressing, one at a time. Halve the tomatoes lengthwise and season with 1 1/2 teaspoons sea salt. Set aside until ready to serve.

When ready to serve, gently add the tomatoes, lettuce, and radicchio to the salad bowl, along with a couple of generous pinches of oregano, and toss to combine with the dressing. Adjust seasonings to taste, adding any reserved dressing if needed. Serve immediately.
